Class WordPlay

  • public class WordPlay
extends java.lang.Object
    Write a description of WordPlay here.
    Version:
    2015-11-18
    Author:
    Pawel Daniluk

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordPlay() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String emphasize(java.lang.String phrase, char ch)
      This method should return a String that is the string phrase but with the Char ch (upper- or lowercase) replaced by asterix if it is in an odd number location in the string (first character has index 0, third character has index 2, etc.), or plus if it is in an even number location in the string (second character has index 1, fourth character has index 3, etc.).
      boolean isVowel(char ch)
      This method returns true if ch is a vowel (one of 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', or 'u' or the uppercase versions) and false otherwise.
      java.lang.String replaceVowels(java.lang.String phrase, char ch)
      Return a String that is the string phrase with all the vowels (uppercase or lowercase) replaced by ch.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isVowel

        public boolean isVowel(char ch)
        This method returns true if ch is a vowel (one of 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', or 'u' or the uppercase versions) and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ch - char to be checked
        Returns:
        true if ch is vowel, false otherwise

      • replaceVowels

        public java.lang.String replaceVowels(java.lang.String phrase,
                                      char ch)
        Return a String that is the string phrase with all the vowels (uppercase or lowercase) replaced by ch.
        Parameters:
        phrase - String to be changed
        ch - character to replace all vovels
        Returns:
        new String that is phrase with vovels replaced by ch

      • emphasize

        public java.lang.String emphasize(java.lang.String phrase,
                                  char ch)
        This method should return a String that is the string phrase but with the Char ch (upper- or lowercase) replaced by asterix if it is in an odd number location in the string (first character has index 0, third character has index 2, etc.), or plus if it is in an even number location in the string (second character has index 1, fourth character has index 3, etc.).
        Parameters:
        phrase - String to be processed
        ch - character to be replaced in string
        Returns:
        phrase with char replaced with asterix or plus
